# Ruud Hendrikx

> Data Scientist & Tech Lead based in Amsterdam area, Netherlands.

Results-driven and highly motivated problem solver with a strong curiosity and an entrepreneurial growth mindset. Thrives in hands-on environments, tackling challenges with a pragmatic, solution-oriented approach. Background in experimental physics, trained in applying first principles thinking to complex problems across disciplines and domains.

Bridges deep technical expertise with strategic insight to drive high-impact machine learning solutions with a strong focus on execution and real-world results. Extensive experience in data-driven research at top-tier institutes and hands-on implementation in business environments. Operates at the intersection of technical execution and business translation.

## Technical Skills

### Python
Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, XGBoost, SimPy, Jupyter Labs, FastAPI

### Analytics
Bayesian Statistics, Machine Learning, Monte Carlo Markov Chain (MCMC)

### Ledger & Data
SQL, NoSQL, Blockchain, Ethereum, Bitcoin, IOTA Tangle, AWS S3

### Programming Languages
Python, R, MATLAB, Mathematica, Solidity, PHP, HTML, JSON

### Repository & Infrastructure
Git, Mercurial, Subversion, Docker, Amazon Web Services (AWS)

### Hardware
Raspberry Pi, Arduino, Home Automation, Network Security

### Creative
Photoshop, Lightroom, After Effects, Quartz Composer, Resolume, Madmapper

### Methods
Lean Start-up, Business Model Canvas, Kanban, Agile, Scrum

## Publications

1. Ferretti, M., Hendrikx, R., Romero, E., Southall, J., Cogdell, R. J., Novoderezhkin, V. I., ... & van Grondelle, R. (2016). **Dark States in the Light-Harvesting complex 2 Revealed by Two-dimensional Electronic Spectroscopy.** Scientific Reports, 6. https://dx.doi.org/10.1038/srep20834

2. Ma, F., Yu, L. J., Hendrikx, R., Wang-Otomo, Z. Y., & van Grondelle, R. (2016). **Direct Observation of Energy Detrapping in LH1-RC Complex by Two-Dimensional Electronic Spectroscopy.** Journal of the American Chemical Society (JACS). https://dx.doi.org/10.1021/jacs.6b11017

3. Ruesink, F., Doeleman, H. M., Hendrikx, R., Koenderink, A. F., & Verhagen, E. (2015). **Perturbing open cavities: Anomalous resonance frequency shifts in a hybrid cavity-nanoantenna system.** Physical Review Letters (PRL), 115(20), 203904. https://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevLett.115.203904

4. Hendrikx, R., Doeleman, H., Ruesink, F., Koenderink, A. F., & Verhagen, E. (2015). **Optical antennas in hybrid photonic systems.** In Microwave Integrated Circuits Conference (EuMIC), 2015 10th European (pp. 397-400). IEEE. http://dx.doi.org/10.1109/EuMIC.2015.7345153

5. Ruesink, F., Doeleman, H. M., Hendrikx, R., Koenderink, F., & Verhagen, E. (2015). **Coupling nanoantennas to microcavities: radiative interactions cause strong and tunable frequency shifts.** In CLEO: QELS_Fundamental Science (pp. FTu2E-6). Optical Society. https://dx.doi.org/10.1364/CLEO_QELS.2015.FTu2E.6

## Awards & Achievements

- Third prize in energy track of Blockchaingers Hackathon 2018, Dutchchain
- University Research Fellow 2015-2016, Faculty of Sciences, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VUA)
